#summary This page describes basic usage of the code.

= Introduction =

The code is not that user friendly, but the supplied [https://code.google.com/p/lattice-switch/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2Fscripts scripts] and [https://code.google.com/p/lattice-switch/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2Fruns example configuration files] should help.


= Basic invocation =

The code is invoked like this, with all supplied classes on the classpath:
{{{
java -Xmx1024m -cp $CLASSPATH net.anjackson.physics.ls.LSSim input.par
}}}

The LSSim class is the main controlled, and all simulation parameters are controlled through the supplied parameter file. Some examples may help:
  * [http://lattice-switch.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/runs/hs-fcchcp/hsls.par An example config file, for hard-sphere FCC-HCP simulation].
  * [https://code.google.com/p/lattice-switch/source/browse/trunk/scripts/hsls.nvt.par.template A template configuration file for NVT hard-sphere simulation].
  * [https://code.google.com/p/lattice-switch/source/browse/trunk/scripts/hsls.npt.par.template A template configuration file for NPT hard-sphere simulation].
  * [https://code.google.com/p/lattice-switch/source/browse/trunk/scripts/nvt-df-run.py A rather complicated example of a script that runs many simulations to explore the parameter space.]
